projectsummary.description: Premium Markets is an automated financial technical analysis system. It implements a graphical environment for monitoring financial technical analysis major indicators, portfolio management and quotations charting. I would also like to bring to your attention that Premium Markets annonces its NEW Forecast engine! See http://premiummarkets.elasticbeanstalk.com/ for documentation and a workable demo of the forecast engine.
projectsummary.registration_description: * Piggy Market Squeak is an easy to use, out of the box, stock trends alert system. * Piggy Market Squeak comes with a user friendly Graphical User Interface. * Piggy Market Squeak will highlight and sort the stocks and shares you should buy and sell, either from a selected market place, or a selected set of shares aggregated in a Portfolio. * Highly versatile, it can integrate any stocks and shares market trend indicators based on open, closed, high and low prices, and trade volumes. * Piggy Market Squeak also provides extensible interfaces to interact with third party indicator calculation tools, any market lists and quotations available on the Internet and any email server. * Pure java application using SWT, the more advanced features of JDK 1.5, multi threading, JMS queue, Spring and more. Highly versatile and customisable.

trove_details.trove_category: Intended Audience :: by End-User Class :: End Users/Desktop
License :: OSI-Approved Open Source :: GNU General Public License version 2.0 (GPLv2)
Intended Audience :: by Industry or Sector :: Financial and Insurance Industry
Operating System :: Grouping and Descriptive Categories :: OS Portable (Source code to work with many OS platforms)

newsitem.summary: Huge improvement in installation and event processing
newsitem.details: 0.1.4 of Piggy Market Squeak is out. It comes with huge installation improvement as well as a better events update process. PMS is now ready to include new signals and new markets as required.
With the 0.1.5, the Nasdaq Market list is now available! Coming soon : an integrated chart viewer.
0.2.0 is out and includes some charting to help in decision making.

This latest piggy market squeak release comes with : A new alert on threshold feature directly available from a right click in the portfolio. A massive amount of bugs fixes, especially in the graph feature. Coming soon : a simple ad hock algebra to define your own alerts based on thresholds, slops, volumes and indicators :)

newsitem.summary: Here is the first fonctional release
newsitem.details: Yet an other piggy market squeak release including, A new indicator : Stochastic oscillators and A massive amount of bugs fixes, especially on the signal generation system. Coming soon : - A reference portfolio auto managed by PMS - Trend indicators per market and sectors - Filters of set of shares - A simple ad hock algebra to define your own alerts based on thresholds, slops, volumes and indicators :)

Hi, Just added an auto managed portfolio. Enjoy.
Guillaume

newsitem.summary: Google finance brings us with the NYSE and AMEX markets
newsitem.details: Added support for google finance API for quotations and market share list. Added NYSE and AMEX markets share lists. Bug fixes.

This release comes with bug fixes of course But also :
- RSI indicator addition
- BSE and ASX markets
In the cardboard : Canadian market. But I would need a link to the list of shares. If any body can help?

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body: Yes that's exactly it. All you need is the indices name used by yahoo. Which means that if you specify ^AORD, the url that will be used is http://uk.old.finance.yahoo.com/d/quotes.csv?s=@^AORD&f=sl1d1t1c1ohgv&e=.csv I checked it so it should just work :) Let me know. Thanks

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body:
Hi Guil,
Let me see if I can explain this. It's difficult for me because I have very little understanding of the way these systems hang together. More so with pms.
First, there are a number of applications that I am using to download EOD data from Yahoo Finance. QTStalker, beancounter, Yahoo and Google Quotes Downloader (Win), etc. In most cases all I have to do is specify a list of symbols (with or without an .AX suffix i.e BHP.AX, RIO.AX, etc) and the software does the rest.
I can also go to the Yahoo website itself : http://au.finance.yahoo.com and download the data manually. The url you have indicated above is meant only, it seems to me, for the ^AORD, the Australian All Ordinaries index. Is that basically the problem? PMS needs more than just the index, right?
I am hoping we'd still be able to sort this out. In the meantime I will continue to familiarize myself with pms. I'll see if I get it to use the eod data I already have.
Thanks.

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body: Hi maskiepop , Yes you are right about the Yahoo share list. pmsq also support yahoo indices In "Quotations" / "Select a maket .." you can also choose to tick yahooIndices and fill the beneath field with INDICE_NAME:MARKETNAME. Unfortunately if believe the following url, http://finance.yahoo.com/intlindices?e=asia, yahoo doesn't look like providing such an indices for the ASX market?

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body:
Hi Guil.
Thanks for your prompt reply.
I found these ASX links:
1) http://www.asx.com.au/asx/research/companyInfo.do?by=asxCode&asxCode=RPX#closing_prices 2) http://www.asx.com.au/asx/research/companyInfo.do?by=asxCode&asxCode=RPX#price 3) http://www.asx.com.au/asx/markets/equityPrices.do
I actually haven't pulled any data from these (don't know how) so I don't know if this is what you want.
#2 are for delayed prices; #1 are for closing prices. #3 I think is probably the correct one, because this allows one to specify multiple stock symbols.
If the above aren't any good -- I'd be happy to just pull the data from Yahoo Finance: http://au.finance.yahoo.com/ How would you set that one up? I was under the impression pms can already pull data from that link, but it doesn't seem to be able to.
Cheers,
m

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body: Hi maskiepop, To run the UI you can double click on the icon that should be on your Desktop after install and if not, you can run the gui.bat in the shell folder. Actually A0S was available, You would have to select it in "Quotations" than "choose market ..." From there, you would have to do a "Refresh stock list " form the same "Quotations" menu. After that, you could have added a new portfolio and the ASX shares should have been available to be added. But I realise I am using that link : http://www.asx.com.au/asx/downloadCsv/ASXListedCompanies.csv which looks like a dead link now? If you have any suggestion for an other link, it would be welcome. Thank you.

forum_post.subject: RE: Latest beta release?
forum_post.body:
Hi
I have just installed your pmsq software. It is, as flashg above, says very interesting.
I am trading ASX shares, and keeping track of my portfolio with excel, and all sorts of tools. I think your pgms is a cut above the rest. Thank you very much.
In one of the posts here -- elizabethann, was inquiring about using this on Australian shares. You mentioned you needed to make a change to the code -- adding a url -- that you may have to do. Can I have the change as well?
And can you please explain a bit more: the url is to download ASX stocks from YFin? EOD data? Intraday as well?
And once the url is in place? Run the service.bat? While pmsq is running? Do I need to set up a list of stocks to be downloaded?
Sorry about all these questions.
I can return the favor. I know very little about java and PC OS. Perhaps I can write some of your documentation?
Thank you very much.

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body: Hi David, It is a different error that you have here though. It say that an other instant of Derby (embedded data base used by Piggy MS) is already running. Just kill this other instant of piggy MS that is running or kill the java programs running in back ground. Try again and let me know :) Cheers.

forum_post.subject: not working on 64bit freebsd
forum_post.body:
fails to run on freebsd amd 64bit 8.0 release. Added the -d32 to switch to gui.sh but get the following error:
"Running a 32-bit JVM is not supported on this platform."
Any ideas?

[Loaded com.finance.pms.admin.install.logging.MyLogger from file:/home/coredump/Modelli/PiggyMarketSqueak/pms.jar]

so I found log4j-1.2.14.jar in the right path and rt.jar the last version and impossible to take it out of the path.(java machine doesn't start). Hope it could be useful. Any further suggestion?
Best regards David

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
Hi all,
I got the same problem on Ubuntu Lucid 64 very annoying! I tried the suggested command java -verbose:class -Djava.library.path=./lib -Dinstalldir=. -jar ./pms.jar ./db.properties > ./vclass.txt but it hangs. (I don't know anything about java - better to say I hate it) How to check and change log4j in simple way ?
Anyway thanks for the job David

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body: No... there is nothing... it seems the application is hang...

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body: Hi there, Can you see any error though?

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
Otherwise... without the -d32 flag, I get the following error:

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
FYI... on both MAC or Linux, I had to add the "-d32" flag to the following line in gui.sh to avoid the following error:
java [b]-d32[/b] -Xmx512M -XX:PermSize=64M -XX:MaxPermSize=128M -Djava.library.path=$INSTALLDIR/lib -Dinstalldir=$INSTALLDIR -jar $INSTALLDIR/pms.jar $INSTALLDIR/db.properties
instead of the original line:
java -Xmx512M -XX:PermSize=64M -XX:MaxPermSize=128M -Djava.library.path=$INSTALLDIR/lib -Dinstalldir=$INSTALLDIR -jar $INSTALLDIR/pms.jar $INSTALLDIR/db.properties

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
Hi, The problem is definitely due to an old version of log4j in the classpath that will be picked up by the class loader before the one provided by the PMS. To solve the problem you have to upgrade that log4j library to the latest on your system. If you don't know where it is you can do the following to find out : - go (cd) in the installation folder of PMS. - on the command line run the following : java -verbose:class -Djava.library.path=./lib -Dinstalldir=. -jar ./pms.jar ./db.properties > ./vclass.txt or (for windows) something like java -verbose:class -Djava.library.path=.\lib -Dinstalldir=. -jar .\pms.jar .\db.properties > .\vclass.txt - when done look for "Logger" in the generated vclass.txt. Hence, you should find the path to the jar to be upgraded. - if it is log4j, you can then update that jar file to the latest. - if it is an other library, either try with the latest or just take it out of the path.
Good luck.

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
Hi, Actually all the dependencies should be included in the installation folder. Your problem looks like your are not using the right version of log4j.
Could you please do the following : Go in <your install path>/PiggyMarketSqueak Open the archive pms.jar (on windows I think that you just have to right click and then open with a zip tool). View the content of following file : pmsbuild.properties and send it to me. Thanks very much!
Guillaume.

forum_post.body: Same error. Are there any special dependencies required ?

forum_post.subject: RE: execution errors
forum_post.body:
Hi, I just re run the installation on both Windows and Linux platform today and it seems to work fine. It looks like you have an older version of the application. I would recommend UN installing it (by deleting the folder where installed) and reinstalling it. At the time of writing, the latest can be found here : http://downloads.sourceforge.net/pmsqueak/PiggyMarketSqueak-0.8.0.jnlp?use_mirror=surfnet
Cheers, Guillaume.

forum_post.subject: RE: Minimal usage help?
forum_post.body:
Hi there, Thank you for using PiggyMarketSqueak :) and sorry for the late response. Regarding your question, when you add "New share ..." you can select multiple shares in the list and specify a common quantity. Than you can modify each line independently in your portfolio by clicking on the cell you want to modify. Click on the Quantity, Cash in or Cash out should pop up a form that would help you. In order to start the automated download, you probably will have to run a script in the back ground (Look in the shell folder, I provided service.bat to add the soft as a service and all.bat that should run the download). Buy/Sell/Neutral/All are tab thumbs that filters the buy and sell events and can present you with a list of share to buy and to sell. The only criterias available to customise your event window at the moment can be set in the top left corner of the event frame (any suggestion about what would should be customisable is by the way very well come). To monitor any progress, you can have a look in the pmsjava.log file.
Enjoy, Kind Regards, Guillaume.

forum_post.subject: Minimal usage help?
forum_post.body:
Hi,
As a newly interested in the stock market mechanism, I downloaded your software. It really looks very good to my limited knowledge! Do you, or could you provide some minimal information as to how to use the program? E.g. I tried to add a new share to MyPortfolio, so there I can choose a share allright, I can also enter the Quantity, but how do I enter the BuyPrice?? Next I don't see any change at all. (I left the system running overnight to allow for downloading whatever...)
In the upper brown region - Buy/Sell/Neutral/All What can I do there - how do I enter information or criteria?
Is there some way I can monitor e.g. a *.txt file or a database or such where I can monitor the program actually doing something?
I realize due to my native Dutch speech some financial 'terms' will somewhat hide their exact meaning to me...
Thanks for helping out!!
Best regards and best whishes! Erwin

forum_post.subject: RE: Australia data?
forum_post.body:
Hi there, As I said earlier on, PMS just needs an url to fetch the list of stocks from the Ausy ASX market. For now, it needs to be added in the source code(which I can do). I think their is something like that available on google. I'll have a look when I have the time.
If no such list is available and in the current state of the source code, you can still set a list of the stocks you want to monitor in your own Portofolio. Which means that you'll have to setup a list of shares you are interested in by uploading them form an independent file.
What is your aim using this tool?
Regards, Guillaume.

forum_post.subject: RE: Australia data?
forum_post.body:
I'm gonna go +1 for Aussie data.
In yahoo finance, the ticker codes have a ".ax" suffix. E.g. TLS.ax, LEI.ax etc.
Is it possible to use PMS with these kinds of codes? Can PMS gather the historical ASX data (I'm a little afraid to experiment considering a wrong assumption will burn a couple of GB in my download quota!)?
Cheers, and looking forward to your reply,
A.

forum_post.subject: RE: compiling from cvs
forum_post.body:
Hi Laurent, To compile from CVS, you will need the requiered libraries and to reference them in your eclipse project.
Here is the list (here in a folder called lib) : lib/commons-logging.jar lib/commons-httpclient-3.0-rc2.jar lib/commons-codec-1.3.jar lib/postgresql-8.1-404.jdbc3.jar lib/hibernate3.jar lib/mail.jar lib/activation.jar lib/ta-lib-0.4.0.jar lib/spring.jar lib/log4j-1.2.12.jar lib/swt.jar lib/derby.jar lib/derbyclient.jar lib/javax.jms.jar
I actually have not commited them yet.
For the command line arguments, you can have a look at the .sh provided in the shell folder - hopefully up to date :). MainGui.java only need the path to db.properties file. MainPMScmd.java should give you a list off requiered paramaters when you run it.

If no such list is available, you can still set a list of the stock you want to monitor in your own Portofolio.
What is your aim using this tool?
Regards, Guillaume.

Elizabeth
